oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mercy Hospital
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Achieving Recognition
Medical Profession
African Americans -- Hospitals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An article about Mercy Hospital in Nashville, opened by African American doctor Dr. Robert F. Boyd.

African Americans were often denied treatment at white owned or operated hospitals during segregation. As a result, African American doctors and colleges owned and operated their own hospitals. Dr. Robert F. Boyd of Nashville opened Mercy Hospital, and Meharry College used it as a training facility.
